elements.name: vaadin-grid-column
elements.description:
A `<vaadin-grid-column>` is used to configure how a column in `<vaadin-grid>`
should look like.

See [`<vaadin-grid>`](https://cdn.vaadin.com/vaadin-web-components/24.0.0-alpha7/#/elements/vaadin-grid) documentation for instructions on how
to configure the `<vaadin-grid-column>`.

attributes.name: ?resizable
attributes.description: When set to true, the column is user-resizable.

attributes.name: ?frozen
attributes.description:
When true, the column is frozen. When a column inside of a column group is frozen,
all of the sibling columns inside the group will get frozen also.

attributes.name: ?frozenToEnd
attributes.description:
When true, the column is frozen to end of grid.

When a column inside of a column group is frozen to end, all of the sibling columns
inside the group will get frozen to end also.

Column can not be set as `frozen` and `frozenToEnd` at the same time.

attributes.name: ?hidden
attributes.description: When set to true, the cells for this column are hidden.

attributes.name: ?autoWidth
attributes.description:
Automatically sets the width of the column based on the column contents when this is set to `true`.

For performance reasons the column width is calculated automatically only once when the grid items
are rendered for the first time and the calculation only considers the rows which are currently
rendered in DOM (a bit more than what is currently visible). If the grid is scrolled, or the cell
content changes, the column width might not match the contents anymore.

Hidden columns are ignored in the calculation and their widths are not automatically updated when
you show a column that was initially hidden.

You can manually trigger the auto sizing behavior again by calling `grid.recalculateColumnWidths()`.

The column width may still grow larger when `flexGrow` is not 0.

attributes.name: .header
attributes.description: Text content to display in the header cell of the column.

attributes.name: .textAlign
attributes.description:
Aligns the columns cell content horizontally.
Supported values: "start", "center" and "end".

attributes.name: .headerRenderer
attributes.description:
Custom function for rendering the header content.
Receives two arguments:

- `root` The header cell content DOM element. Append your content to it.
- `column` The `<vaadin-grid-column>` element.

attributes.name: .footerRenderer
attributes.description:
Custom function for rendering the footer content.
Receives two arguments:

- `root` The footer cell content DOM element. Append your content to it.
- `column` The `<vaadin-grid-column>` element.

attributes.name: .width
attributes.description: Width of the cells for this column.

attributes.name: .flexGrow
attributes.description: Flex grow ratio for the cell widths. When set to 0, cell width is fixed.

attributes.name: .renderer
attributes.description:
Custom function for rendering the cell content.
Receives three arguments:

- `root` The cell content DOM element. Append your content to it.
- `column` The `<vaadin-grid-column>` element.
- `model` The object with the properties related with
  the rendered item, contains:
  - `model.index` The index of the item.
  - `model.item` The item.
  - `model.expanded` Sublevel toggle state.
  - `model.level` Level of the tree represented with a horizontal offset of the toggle button.
  - `model.selected` Selected state.
  - `model.detailsOpened` Details opened state.

attributes.name: .path
attributes.description:
Path to an item sub-property whose value gets displayed in the column body cells.
The property name is also shown in the column header if an explicit header or renderer isn't defined.

elements.name: vaadin-grid-filter

attributes.name: .path
attributes.description: JS Path of the property in the item used for filtering the data.

attributes.name: .value
attributes.description: Current filter value.

attributes.name: @value-changed
attributes.description: Fired when the `value` property changes.

elements.name: vaadin-grid-filter-column
elements.description:
`<vaadin-grid-filter-column>` is a helper element for the `<vaadin-grid>`
that provides default header renderer and functionality for filtering.

#### Example:
```html
<vaadin-grid items="[[items]]">
 <vaadin-grid-filter-column path="name.first"></vaadin-grid-filter-column>

 <vaadin-grid-column>
   ...
```

attributes.name: ?resizable
attributes.description: When set to true, the column is user-resizable.

attributes.name: ?frozen
attributes.description:
When true, the column is frozen. When a column inside of a column group is frozen,
all of the sibling columns inside the group will get frozen also.

attributes.name: ?frozenToEnd
attributes.description:
When true, the column is frozen to end of grid.

When a column inside of a column group is frozen to end, all of the sibling columns
inside the group will get frozen to end also.

Column can not be set as `frozen` and `frozenToEnd` at the same time.

attributes.name: ?hidden
attributes.description: When set to true, the cells for this column are hidden.

attributes.name: ?autoWidth
attributes.description:
Automatically sets the width of the column based on the column contents when this is set to `true`.

For performance reasons the column width is calculated automatically only once when the grid items
are rendered for the first time and the calculation only considers the rows which are currently
rendered in DOM (a bit more than what is currently visible). If the grid is scrolled, or the cell
content changes, the column width might not match the contents anymore.

Hidden columns are ignored in the calculation and their widths are not automatically updated when
you show a column that was initially hidden.

You can manually trigger the auto sizing behavior again by calling `grid.recalculateColumnWidths()`.

The column width may still grow larger when `flexGrow` is not 0.

attributes.name: .header
attributes.description: Text to display as the label of the column filter text-field.

attributes.name: .textAlign
attributes.description:
Aligns the columns cell content horizontally.
Supported values: "start", "center" and "end".

attributes.name: .headerRenderer
attributes.description:
Custom function for rendering the header content.
Receives two arguments:

- `root` The header cell content DOM element. Append your content to it.
- `column` The `<vaadin-grid-column>` element.

attributes.name: .footerRenderer
attributes.description:
Custom function for rendering the footer content.
Receives two arguments:

- `root` The footer cell content DOM element. Append your content to it.
- `column` The `<vaadin-grid-column>` element.

attributes.name: .width
attributes.description: Width of the cells for this column.

attributes.name: .flexGrow
attributes.description: Flex grow ratio for the cell widths. When set to 0, cell width is fixed.

attributes.name: .renderer
attributes.description:
Custom function for rendering the cell content.
Receives three arguments:

- `root` The cell content DOM element. Append your content to it.
- `column` The `<vaadin-grid-column>` element.
- `model` The object with the properties related with
  the rendered item, contains:
  - `model.index` The index of the item.
  - `model.item` The item.
  - `model.expanded` Sublevel toggle state.
  - `model.level` Level of the tree represented with a horizontal offset of the toggle button.
  - `model.selected` Selected state.
  - `model.detailsOpened` Details opened state.

attributes.name: .path
attributes.description: JS Path of the property in the item used for filtering the data.

elements.name: vaadin-grid-selection-column
elements.description:
`<vaadin-grid-selection-column>` is a helper element for the `<vaadin-grid>`
that provides default renderers and functionality for item selection.

#### Example:
```html
<vaadin-grid items="[[items]]">
 <vaadin-grid-selection-column frozen auto-select></vaadin-grid-selection-column>

 <vaadin-grid-column>
   ...
```

By default the selection column displays `<vaadin-checkbox>` elements in the
column cells. The checkboxes in the body rows toggle selection of the corresponding row items.

When the grid data is provided as an array of [`items`](https://cdn.vaadin.com/vaadin-web-components/24.0.0-alpha7/#/elements/vaadin-grid#property-items),
the column header gets an additional checkbox that can be used for toggling
selection for all the items at once.

__The default content can also be overridden__

attributes.name: ?resizable
attributes.description: When set to true, the column is user-resizable.

attributes.name: ?frozen
attributes.description:
When true, the column is frozen. When a column inside of a column group is frozen,
all of the sibling columns inside the group will get frozen also.

attributes.name: ?frozenToEnd
attributes.description:
When true, the column is frozen to end of grid.

When a column inside of a column group is frozen to end, all of the sibling columns
inside the group will get frozen to end also.

Column can not be set as `frozen` and `frozenToEnd` at the same time.

attributes.name: ?hidden
attributes.description: When set to true, the cells for this column are hidden.

attributes.name: ?autoWidth
attributes.description:

For performance reasons the column width is calculated automatically only once when the grid items

Hidden columns are ignored in the calculation and their widths are not automatically updated when
you show a column that was initially hidden.

You can manually trigger the auto sizing behavior again by calling `grid.recalculateColumnWidths()`.

The column width may still grow larger when `flexGrow` is not 0.

attributes.name: ?selectAll
attributes.description: When true, all the items are selected.

attributes.name: ?autoSelect
attributes.description: When true, the active gets automatically selected.

attributes.name: .header
attributes.description: Text content to display in the header cell of the column.

attributes.name: .textAlign
attributes.description:
Aligns the columns cell content horizontally.
Supported values: "start", "center" and "end".

attributes.name: .path
attributes.description:
Path to an item sub-property whose value gets displayed in the column body cells.

attributes.name: @select-all-changed
attributes.description: Fired when the `selectAll` property changes.

elements.name: vaadin-grid-sorter

attributes.name: .path
attributes.description: JS Path of the property in the item used for sorting the data.

attributes.name: .direction
attributes.description:
How to sort the data.
Possible values are `asc` to use an ascending algorithm, `desc` to sort the data in
descending direction, or `null` for not sorting the data.

attributes.name: @direction-changed
attributes.description: Fired when the `direction` property changes.

elements.name: vaadin-grid-sort-column
elements.description:
`<vaadin-grid-sort-column>` is a helper element for the `<vaadin-grid>`
that provides default header renderer and functionality for sorting.

#### Example:
```html
<vaadin-grid items="[[items]]">
 <vaadin-grid-sort-column path="name.first" direction="asc"></vaadin-grid-sort-column>

 <vaadin-grid-column>
   ...
```

elements.name: vaadin-grid-tree-toggle

attributes.name: ?leaf
attributes.description: Hides the toggle icon and disables toggling a tree sublevel.

attributes.name: ?expanded
attributes.description: Sublevel toggle state.

attributes.name: .level
attributes.description:
Current level of the tree represented with a horizontal offset
of the toggle button.

attributes.name: @expanded-changed
attributes.description: Fired when the `expanded` property changes.

elements.name: vaadin-grid-tree-column
elements.description:
`<vaadin-grid-tree-column>` is a helper element for the `<vaadin-grid>`
that provides default renderer and functionality for toggling tree/hierarchical items.

#### Example:
```html
<vaadin-grid items="[[items]]">
 <vaadin-grid-tree-column path="name.first"></vaadin-grid-tree-column>

 <vaadin-grid-column>
   ...
```
